intro: Columnea cobana, commonly known as the Cobana flame flower, is a tropical plant native to Central America. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. Its foliage consists of dark green, ovate leaves that are glossy and somewhat succulent. Columnea cobana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable conditions.
